snippet: The Penny Harvest program, in which children collect pennies to help others, may end if the nonprofit group that runs it has to close.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on possibility that Common Cents, small nonprofit group that runs New York City’s grand penny harvest, is near death; holds that loss of Common Cents would mean loss of one of the nation’s most innovative programs for teaching elementary school children about philanthropy, and blames New York City's Education Department for situation.
lead_paragraph: The Penny Harvest program, in which children collect pennies to help others, may end if the nonprofit group that runs it has to close.

headline.seo: Charity Program Operated by Students at Risk
headline.main: Schoolchildren at Their Most Generous, City Bureaucracy at Its Least
headline.print_headline: Schoolchildren at Their Most Generous, City Bureaucracy at Its Least
